    First and second order derivatives of the log-likelihood with weibull baseline risk

    derivaweib.Rd

    First and second order derivatives of the log-likelihood with weibull baseline risk

    derivaweib(
  b,
  npm,
  npar,
  bfix,
  fix,
  ctime,
  no,
  ve01,
  ve02,
  ve12,
  dimnva01,
  dimnva02,
  dimnva12,
  nva01,
  nva02,
  nva12,
  t0,
  t1,
  t2,
  t3,
  troncature
)

    Arguments

    b

    parameters on explanatory variables not fixed

    npm

    number of parameters not fixed, thus length of b

    npar

    number of parameters

    bfix

    parameters on explanatory variables fixed

    fix

    indicator of length npar, values 1 if parameter fixed

    ctime

    profile of patients from 1 to 7

    no

    number of subjects

    ve01

    variables for transition 0 –>1

    ve02

    variables for transition 0 –>2

    ve12

    variables for transition 1 –>2

    dimnva01

    number of variables for transition 0 –>1, if not variables value 1

    dimnva02

    number of variables for transition 0 –>2, if not variables value 1

    dimnva12

    number of variables for transition 1 –>2, if not variables value 1

    nva01

    number of variables for transition 0 –>1, if not variables value 0

    nva02

    number of variables for transition 0 –>2, if not variables value 0

    nva12

    number of variables for transition 1 –>2, if not variables value 0

    t0

    time of entry

    t1

    time of last visit or last visit without diagnose of illness

    t2

    time of last visit or time diagnose of illness

    t3

    time of last visit or death

    troncature

    indicator of troncature, value 1 if there is troncature otherwise 0.

    Author

    R: Ariane Bercu <ariane.bercu@u-bordeaux.fr>

    Contents

    Developed by Ariane Bercu.
